title_full:
Ka

            —
            The Thief Next to Jesus

label: Thrill Jockey
description:
Aaron Turner (Isis) and his revered trio Sumac heavily fuck with metal structures and convention on four durational pieces that play with anticipatory and proprioceptive senses, trailing the might of their 2022 Keiji Haino collaboration.

On ‘The Healer’ Sumac reprise their role at metal’s vanguard with expansive arrangements of Turner’s signature, claw-handled guitars and hoarse croak, Brian Cook’s abyssal bass guitar, and Nick Yacyshyn’s guillotine drums, all prone to leave it all hanging in the... more

artist: E L U C I D
title_full:
E L U C I D

              —
              REVELATOR
            
              (Fat Possum)
label: Fat Possum
description:
Armand Hammer’s E L U C I D is joined by spar Billy Woods on a seething, urgent volley of noise rap recalling the ‘00s heyday of Def Jux and Dälek after a slew of cult turns with Backwoodz Studioz and Geng’s Purple Tape Pedigree

Spurred by production by DJ Haram, Samiyam, Saint Abdullah, a.o., and his own beats, E L U C I D continues to draw on a well of fire for his 10th solo album since 2007. The diverse roster of beat builders are unified by Hall’s bars, mutating from the barked... more

label: ANTI
description:
Moor Mother pulls no punches on her knockout ninth LP highlighting Britain’s role in the slave trade, starring guests Lonnie Holley, Mary Lattimore, Alya Al Sultani Kyle Kidd and more

‘The Great Bailout’ is a scalding, multi-layered reminder of how the British establishment passed the buck to taxpayers - including the Windrush generation, and their descendants - in their compensation of slave owners following the 1835 Slavery Abolition Act, whilst not a single penny went to the enslaved... more

label: Matador
description:
With over four decades of relentless reinvention and innovation under her belt, Kim Gordon embraces failure on her mind-boggling latest solo LP, rapping and groaning over industrialized, hybrid trap beats that push so far into the red they almost disintegrate. Where a lesser presence could have let that production dominate, Gordon is always the total focus of our attention, the rhythm - as sick as it is - functions almost like a stock backing track, such is her shine. Essential gear.

We should have... more

label: Timedance
description:
Batu’s Timedance look to Latin America’s prevailing club currency with Verraco’s hi-tech twiss-ups chasing his slew of aces for Tra Tra Trax’s Insurgentes and Blawan’s Voam

Verraco has emerged as one of Medellín, Colombia’s leading club catalysts. With ‘Breathe… Godspeed’ he trims tresillo rhythms to chattering and rave-chewing electronics in four parts that snap and bite with a Raptor House energy decimated and rearranged for more demanding, trippy dancers, much in the same way the... more

label: Houndstooth
description:
More Squarepusher than Photek, with his first solo release in five years Felix Manuel cracks his knuckles and welds together all his far-flung influences - from singeli and gabber to deep house and dubstep - finishing it all off with his own flute playing, and a tonne of Prog flexing.

'Meaning's Edge' traces DJRum's energy over a suite of tracks that hang together so precariously you'll stand to break a sweat. It shouldn't work, but Manuel's absorbed enough music that he knows when to hang back... more

label: LUCKYME®
description:
Tidal Memory Exo is the third album from Bristol-based musician Iglooghost.

"Iglooghost's untethered music and forensically detailed worldbuilding has gained him an avid following. Made while squatting in an old MOT garage on the Kent Coast, Tidal Memory Exo sees Iglooghost take the fore as a vocalist for the first time. The album takes place in a coastal town cut off from the mainland and plagued by a never ending storm, where the locals have created their own music scene with genres... more

title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              no pare, sigue sigue 3
            
              (TraTraTrax Records)
label: TraTraTrax Records
description:
The mighty TraTraTrax returns with another prescient state of the union address, feeling out dancefloor futures with destructive continuum-piercing deployments from 3Phaz, Shapednoise, Lurka, DJ Plead, Luca Durán, coffintexts, De Grandi and loads more.

The Colombian label's already treated us to the best club album of the year (that'd be Lechuga Zafiro's extraordinary 'Desde los o​í​dos de un sapo'), and now we've been handed the third in their ongoing annual series of landscape-defining... more

title_full:
KMRU, Kevin Richard Martin

              —
              Disconnect
            
              (PHANTOM LIMB)
label: PHANTOM LIMB
description:
KMRU's first collaboration with Kevin Martin (aka The Bug) is a genuine surprise - shelving his mics and synthesizers, KMRU unleashes his voice, keening softly and adding chilling spoken word passages to Martin's soundsystem-baiting drones and frozen, cinematic orchestrals.

We've heard plenty of different music from KMRU over the last few years, but until now, his voice is an element he's left relatively unexplored. It was an invitation from Martin that prompted the experimentation; Martin... more
